question.text: 在驾驶时，要识别周边的危险，你应该

answers.answer: 定期扫描驾驶环境
answers.distractor_1: 只将你的目光直接放在前方的道路上
answers.distractor_3: 调整你的收音机以接收本地交通信息

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do
question.source: Do not overdrive your ability to see. You should always be able to prepare for a potential hazard instead of being taken by surprise.

question.text:
在自动变速箱的车辆上，第一档和第二档驱动档（D1，D2）应在以下情况下使用
On a vehicle with AUTOMATIC transmission, when should the first and second DRIVE (D1, D2) gears be used

answers.answer: 在拖拉重载或者上下非常陡峭的山坡时。

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Comparing Automatic and Standard Transmissions
question.source: There are two types of transmissions: automatic and standard. Both control the connection between the engine and the wheels.

question.text: 以下哪项不是您每次驾驶前应进行的出行前检查的一部分？

answers.answer: 检查冷却液和油位。
answers.distractor_1: 检查侧视镜和后视镜是否调整正确。
answers.distractor_2: 检查头枕和安全带是否调整正确。

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Pre-trip Check.
question.source: To ensure good maintenance, you need to do a more thorough pre-trip check every few weeks.

question.text: 安全带在以下情况下最能有效预防伤害

answers.answer: 腰带和肩带正确佩戴时。

question.chapter: Chapter 2: You and Your Vehicle; Seatbelts
question.source: Wearing a seatbelt significantly reduces your chance of serious injury or death in a crash.

question.text: 作为驾驶员，您应该

answers.answer: 不断检查道路两侧及所有的后视镜，以及前方的道路

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: It is important that you pay attention to things outside your central vision. Peripheral vision allows you to see more than what is directly in front of you.

question.text: 当您右转时，您应该肩部检查以

answers.answer: 确保没有自行车手或其他道路使用者在您旁边
answers.distractor_1: 确保您处于正确的车道
answers.distractor_2: 警告后面的车辆您打算转弯
answers.distractor_3: 确保您后面的车辆不太靠近

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

question.text: 汽车A的驾驶员正确的“看-想-做”策略是？

answers.answer: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要更多的空间。”；减速并逐渐在前方留出更大的缓冲区。
answers.distractor_1: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要脱身。”；加速以在后方留出更多空间。
answers.distractor_2: 看到卡车C右侧有小空隙；想到，“我可以挤过去。”；加速并变道。
answers.distractor_3: 看到汽车B紧跟在后；想到，“我需要更多空间。”；突然刹车以吓到汽车B的驾驶员。

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do
question.source: it's a good idea to slow down slightly to increase your space in front. This way, if you have to stop, you can stop more gradually ...

question.text: 在什么情况下你不需要做肩部检查？

answers.answer: 当判断你的跟车距离时。

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

question.text: 直接在汽车A的盲点中的是哪辆车？

answers.answer: 汽车D

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Even when your mirrors are properly adjusted, there are large areas that you can't see in your mirrors. These are called blind spots.

question.text: 检查盲点中的车辆最好的方式是通过

answers.answer: 越过你的肩膀看

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Observation
question.source: Whenever you plan a change in direction or road position, do a shoulder check to make sure the blind spot on that side is clear.

question.text: 反应时间受到以下情况影响最大

answers.answer: 饮酒后

question.chapter: Chapter 7: Personal Strategies; Facts About Alcohol
question.source: In some cases, even small amounts of alcohol can cause a driver to be impaired.

question.text: 这位骑自行车的人将要做什么？

answers.answer: 停下或减速。

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Communication
question.source: This section has an illustration that shows how cyclists signal left turns, right turns, and stopping or slowing down.

question.text: 驾驶员不应该在以下情况下变换车道

answers.answer: 在交叉路口

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road
question.source: Don't change lanes at an intersection. You could confuse other drivers and cause a crash.

question.text: 除非另有标示，城镇内的速度限制是

answers.answer: 50公里/小时

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Speed Control
question.source: Unless a sign tells you otherwise, the speed limit is 50km/h within cities and towns.

question.text: 汽车A的驾驶员应该怎么做？

answers.answer: 减速以允许汽车B安全进入。
answers.distractor_1: 加速以超过正在合并的汽车B。
answers.distractor_2: 减速，按喇叭，并向汽车B挥手。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: When you are driving in the right lane of a freeway, other drivers may try to merge from an entrance lane. It's not always easy for them to find a safe gap.

question.text: 在你开始超车之前，你应该

answers.answer: 能够清楚地看到前方

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Assess the Risk
question.source: In assessing just how risky this situation is, you should ask yourself what could happen. What if there is an unexpected obstacle just around the curve?

question.text: 你不应该在以下情况超过其他车辆

answers.answer: 当你的视线受阻时
answers.distractor_1: 在一条不熟悉的道路上

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Hazard Perception
question.source: Be extra cautious when anything blocks your view. Never pass when you are approaching the top of a hill.

question.text: 超过指示的速度限制是非法的

answers.answer: 始终
answers.distractor_1: 除了在偏远或无人居住的地区

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Speed Control
question.source: The posted speed is the maximum for ideal conditions only. Choose a lower speed if the conditions are not ideal.

question.text: 如果你在高速公路上跟在一辆大型车辆或摩托车后面，你的跟车距离至少应该是

answers.answer: 3秒钟

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Allow at least three seconds following distance when you are behind a large vehicle that could block your vision or a motorcycle that could stop very quickly.

question.text: 在恶劣天气或高速公路上的湿滑路况下，你的跟车距离至少应该是

answers.answer: 4秒钟

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Increase your following distance to three seconds on high-speed roads and to four seconds in bad weather conditions or on uneven or slippery roads.

question.text: 行人和骑自行车的人最容易受到车辆的威胁，因为

answers.answer: 他们在事故中更有可能受到严重伤害，而不像汽车司机和乘客
answers.distractor_1: 他们不需要遵守道路规则
answers.distractor_2: 他们在事故发生时更经常有过错

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road
question.source: Of all road users, pedestrians are among the most vulnerable. You always need to watch out for them. Pedestrians, like all road users, can be unpredictable.

question.text: 自行车手A面临的最直接危险是什么？

answers.answer: 汽车B的驾驶员可能没有注意到自行车手A并转向其行驶路径。
answers.distractor_1: 行人可能会走入自行车手A的行驶路径。
answers.distractor_2: 汽车C的驾驶员可能会撞上自行车手A的后方。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Be aware that cyclists don't always stay on the right. To make a left turn, for instance, they need to move over to the left lane.

question.text: 你必须停下来给校车让路

answers.answer: 当它的红灯在闪烁时

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; School buses
question.source: Stop whenever you see flashing lights on a school bus.

question.text: 如果你看到路边的行人想要横穿马路，你应该

answers.answer: 减速并准备停车
answers.distractor_1: 保持你的速度，因为你有通行权

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: You must always be prepared to stop if you see a pedestrian who is about to step out in front of you. However, don't encourage jaywalking.

question.text: 持白色手杖的行人应该被特别小心对待，因为

answers.answer: 他们在过马路时可能会感到不确定
answers.distractor_1: 他们会在任何地方横穿马路
answers.distractor_2: 他们不必遵守道路规则
answers.distractor_3: 他们听不到你的车辆声音

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: Often, a blind or partially blind person will raise their cane when uncertain of crossing the street safely. That is your signal to stop.

question.text: 如果前方发生问题，哪辆车没有逃生路线？

answers.answer: 汽车A

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Try to leave yourself an escape route when you are driving on a multi-lane highway. Then, if something happens in front, you can pull into another lane.

question.text: 汽车A

answers.answer: 可能不会通过

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow lines divide traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken line and a solid line mean you may pass only when it is safe and the broken line is on your side.

question.text: 这个标志的意思是

answers.answer: 前方道路变窄

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Most warning signs are yellow and diamond-shaped. They warn of possible hazards ahead.

question.text: 与你车辆周围的骑自行车者进行眼神交流

answers.answer: 是一种良好的沟通方式
answers.distractor_1: 可能导致他们失去平衡

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: A cyclist often relies on eye contact as a means of communication. Make eye contact if you can. She or he is probably trying to anticipate your next move.

question.text: 如果你注意到一个司机左右摇晃方向盘或没有原因地停车，你应该

answers.answer: 给自己额外的空间

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Hazard Perception
question.source: To avoid surprises, think well ahead and ask yourself what could possibly happen in the driving environment.

question.text: 停在路边的公共交通巴士

answers.answer: 可能会隐藏准备过马路的行人
answers.distractor_2: 看不到会超越它们的车辆
answers.distractor_3: 在进入交通之前必须按喇叭

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Public Transit Buses
question.source: Watch for buses that have stopped -- they may block your view of pedestrians about to cross the street, or they may be about to pull into traffic.

question.text: 当从车道驶出驶入带有人行道的街道时，汽车A的驾驶员必须在进入街道之前做什么？

answers.answer: 在人行道前停车
answers.distractor_1: 准备停车，但如果没有识别到危险，就继续进入街道。
answers.distractor_3: 在进入街道前刚好停在人行道的后面

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: When you are pulling out of a driveway, alley or parking lot onto a road, stop before the sidewalk or area where pedestrians may be walking.

question.text: 你的空间边距是指

answers.answer: 你的车辆和其他道路使用者之间的距离
answers.distractor_1: 你的车辆和你前面的车辆之间的距离
answers.distractor_2: 你的车辆和你后面的车辆之间的距离
answers.distractor_3: 你的车辆和路缘之间的距离

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: You must have room to move if you need it. Space margins include your space in front, behind, beside and your lane position.

question.text: 驾驶过于靠近前面的车辆的一个危险是

answers.answer: 你可能无法看到前方的情况
answers.distractor_1: 你会挡住前面车辆的后视镜
answers.distractor_2: 你会迫使前面的车辆加速
answers.distractor_3: 你会处于前面车辆的盲点

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Space Margins
question.source: Tailgating (following too closely behind the vehicle in front) is a major cause of crashes. If you tailgate, the vehicle in front can block your view of hazards ahead.

question.text: 司机应该给骑自行车的人更多的空间，因为他们

answers.answer: 可能会突然转向或变道
answers.distractor_3: 不必遵守同样的道路规则

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Allow side margins - a significant number of crashes involving cyclists result from side-swiping. Make sure there is enough space if you want to pass a cyclist.

question.text: 这辆车可能会

answers.answer: 不可以超车，但可以左转越线
answers.distractor_1: 可以超车，但不能左转越线
answers.distractor_2: 不可以超车或左转越线

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow lines divide traffic moving in opposite directions. A broken line and a solid line mean you may pass only when it is safe and the broken line is on your side.

question.text: 当卡车正在倒车时，你不应该从后面悄悄接近，因为

answers.answer: 如果你进入其中一个盲区，会很危险
answers.distractor_1: 它们的制动系统比汽车效果更差
answers.distractor_2: 它们比你的车辆承载更多的重量
answers.distractor_3: 卡车可能会产生过多的湍流

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Large Vehicles
question.source: Never try to sneak behind a truck if it is backing into a loading bay or out of a driveway because you will enter one of the truck driver's blind spots and risk being hit.

question.text: 你正在沿着一条多车道单向街道行驶。你在后视镜里看到一辆紧急车辆的灯光在闪烁。你应该

answers.answer: 安全地移动到路的任意一侧并停车
answers.distractor_2: 减速并移动到路的任意一侧

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: Usually the best thing to do is pull over to the right and stop (or to the left if you're driving in the left lane of a divided highway or on a one-way street).

question.text: 车辆A的交通信号灯刚刚变绿。一辆带有闪烁灯光的救护车从后方驶来。车辆A应该怎么做？

answers.answer: 向右转，为救护车让路。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: If you are stopped at an intersection and you are blocking the path of the emergency vehicle, you may have to turn the corner to get out of the way.

question.text: 你正在行驶在分隔的公路的左车道。你在后视镜里看到一辆带有闪烁灯光的紧急车辆。你应该

answers.answer: 安全地移动到最近的路边并停车
answers.distractor_1: 减速并移动到路的任意一侧

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Emergency Vehicles
question.source: Usually the best thing to do is pull over to the right and stop (or to the left if you are driving in the left lane of a divided highway or on a one-way street).

question.text: 在这个十字路口左转，车辆A应该

answers.answer: 在转弯之前移动到左车道
answers.distractor_3: 在转弯之前移动到右车道

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Using Lanes Correctly
question.source: Before you make a turn, you need to get your vehicle into the correct lane. Then you need to end up in the correct lane when you complete your turn.

question.text: 在你停在红灯处之后，你可以

answers.answer: 向右转或者向左转进入单行道，如果安全并且没有标志禁止

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Watch for signs prohibiting you from making these turns on a red light.

question.text: 在双车道道路上被超车时，你应该做好准备

answers.answer: 减速并腾出空间，让他们能够安全超车
answers.distractor_3: 在路肩上行驶时保持你的速度

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Passing

question.text: 汽车A的驾驶员应该怎么做？

answers.answer: 减速并停车。
answers.distractor_1: 加速以在行人踏上人行横道前通过。
answers.distractor_3: 减速以防行人踏入人行横道。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Pedestrians
question.source: You must yield to pedestrians in marked crosswalks, if the pedestrian is close to your half of the road.

question.text: 在这个交通环岛中，车辆A的驾驶员想要沿B街前行。正确的路径是

answers.answer: 让交通环岛内的车辆优先通行，在安全的情况下右转，并沿B路径向右驶出
answers.distractor_1: 等到摩托车C通过后立即左转
answers.distractor_2: 在交通环岛内完整绕行一圈后再退出
answers.distractor_3: 等待交通环岛内没有车辆后，然后左转

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: All vehicles must turn right to enter a traffic circle and right again to leave it.

question.text: 汽车A和汽车B同时到达了停车标志。谁应该先行？

answers.answer: 汽车B。
answers.distractor_3: 两辆车都应该等待汽车C到达路口。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: If two vehicles arrive at a four-way stop at the same time, the one on the right should go first.

question.text: 汽车B先到达了停车标志。谁应该先行？

answers.answer: 汽车B。
answers.distractor_2: 汽车B应该示意汽车A通过。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: The first vehicle to arrive at the intersection of a four-way stop and come to a complete stop should go first.

question.text: 你是汽车A的驾驶员，想要右转。哪种是最好的看-思考-行动策略？

answers.answer: 我看到自行车B正在靠近；我想，“当我想要转弯时，自行车可能已经在转角处”；我减速。
answers.distractor_1: 我看到前面的转角；我想，“我将迟到会议了”；我加速并转弯。
answers.distractor_2: 我看到自行车B；我想，“我可以先到转角”；我加速并转弯。
answers.distractor_3: 我看到自行车B；我想，“我有优先通行权”；我按喇叭并转弯。

question.chapter: Chapter 6: Sharing the Road; Cyclists
question.source: Yield to cyclists as you would to any other vehicle. If you have the right-of-way at an intersection, proceed if it is safe.

question.text: 交通信号灯刚刚变成黄色。周围没有其他车辆。车辆A应该

answers.answer: 减速并停车，因为这样做是安全的
answers.distractor_1: 加速通过，以免它变成红色
answers.distractor_2: 扫描路口，保持速度，直接通过
answers.distractor_3: 停下来，然后通过红灯，因为没有其他车辆

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: Yellow means that the signal is about the turn red. You must stop before entering the intersection unless you cannot safely stop in time.

question.text: 手势信号

answers.answer: 在转向灯难以看清时应该使用
answers.distractor_1: 在好天气下应该始终使用
answers.distractor_2: 仅由骑自行车和摩托车的人使用
answers.distractor_3: 只会让其他人困惑，不应该使用

question.chapter: Chapter 5: See - Think - Do; Communication
question.source: There are times when an automatic turn signal is hard to see in these situations, use a hand signal in addition to the turn signal.

question.text: 在进行左转之前，驾驶员应该

answers.answer: 给对向行驶的车辆让路，并等待一个安全的间隙
answers.distractor_1: 向后面的车辆示意让行
answers.distractor_3: 等待对向驾驶员示意让你通过

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Right-of-Way at Intersections
question.source: When making a left turn on a green light, you must yield to oncoming traffic and wait for a safe gap before you turn.

question.text: 当你在左侧看到一条实线时，意味着

answers.answer: 你不能变换车道
answers.distractor_1: 它是分隔不同方向行驶的车辆的
answers.distractor_3: 只有公共交通车辆可以超车。

question.chapter: Chapter 3: Signs, Signals and Road Markings
question.source: White lines are used to separate lanes of traffic moving in the same direction. A solid line means do not change lanes.

question.text: 汽车A的驾驶员应该

answers.answer: 以交通流速度进入高速公路
answers.distractor_2: 比交通流速度更快地行驶以更好地操控
answers.distractor_3: 在进入高速公路前减速

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: A highway entrance gives you a short distance to match your speed to the vehicles already on the highway.

question.text: 在加速车道上，驶入高速公路之前，驾驶员应该

answers.answer: 加速以匹配交通速度。

question.chapter: Chapter 4: Rules of the Road; Highway or Freeway Entrances and Exits
question.source: The acceleration lane is divided from the rest of the roadway by a solid white line. Use this lane to match your speed to the speed of the traffic on the freeway.

question.text: 当退出高速公路时，你应该减速

answers.answer: 当你已经进入出口车道之后。
answers.distractor_1: 在你进入出口车道之前。
answers.distractor_2: 在你打开转向灯表示你要驶出高速公路之前。

question.text: 你在农村地区的多车道高速公路的左车道以90公里/小时的速度行驶。你必须换到右边车道吗？
